articles.headline: A Century After Phony Flu Ads, Companies Hype Dubious Covid Cures
articles.snippet: Musical medicine? Corona-fighting herbs? “Human beings haven’t changed all that much,” a marketing professor says of the similarities between ads from 1918 and recent months.
articles.abstract: Musical medicine? Corona-fighting herbs? “Human beings haven’t changed all that much,” a marketing professor says of the similarities between ads from 1918 and recent months.
articles.lead_paragraph: With a pandemic raging, a spate of ads promised dubious remedies in the form of lozenges, tonics, unguents, blood-builders and an antiseptic shield to be used while kissing.

articles.headline: For a Defeated President, Pardons as an Expression of Grievance
articles.snippet: President Trump’s grants of clemency to convicted liars, corrupt congressmen and child-killing war criminals are a way to lash out at a system that he believes has treated him and his friends unfairly.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s grants of clemency to convicted liars, corrupt congressmen and child-killing war criminals are a way to lash out at a system that he believes has treated him and his friends unfairly.
articles.lead_paragraph: The statement announcing the latest raft of presidential pardons was officially attributed to the White House press secretary, but it bristled with President Trump’s own deep-seated grievances.

articles.headline: An Oscar Winner Made a Khashoggi Documentary. Streaming Services Didn’t Want It.
articles.snippet: Bryan Fogel’s examination of the killing of the Saudi dissident Jamal Khashoggi had trouble finding a home among the companies that can be premier platforms for documentary films.
articles.abstract: Bryan Fogel’s examination of the killing of the Saudi dissident Jamal Khashoggi had trouble finding a home among the companies that can be premier platforms for documentary films.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bryan Fogel’s first documentary, “Icarus,” helped uncover the Russian doping scandal that led to the country’s expulsion from the 2018 Winter Olympics. It also won an Oscar for him and for Netflix, which released the film.

articles.headline: Behind Trump Clemency, a Case Study in Special Access
articles.snippet: Philip Esformes was sentenced last year to 20 years for Medicare fraud. Then a well-connected organization supported by his family weighed in with the White House.
articles.abstract: Philip Esformes was sentenced last year to 20 years for Medicare fraud. Then a well-connected organization supported by his family weighed in with the White House.
articles.lead_paragraph: Philip Esformes acquired a $1.6 million Ferrari and a $360,000 Swiss watch and traveled around the United States on a private jet, a spending spree fueled by the spoils from what federal prosecutors called one of the largest Medicare fraud cases in history.
articles.byline: By Kenneth P. Vogel, Eric Lipton and Jesse Drucker

articles.headline: ‘Stay Alive and Survive’: Ski Resorts Brace for a Pandemic Season
articles.snippet: Many have put capacity restrictions in place, even as new lockdowns may spook visitors.
articles.abstract: Many have put capacity restrictions in place, even as new lockdowns may spook visitors.
articles.lead_paragraph: OLYMPIC VALLEY, Calif. — A trickle of skiers recently zigzagged down the slopes at the Squaw Valley Ski Resort. Couples and families wandered through the resort’s village, which was decorated with golden Christmas lights and frosted with snow.
